name: Anklet of the Great Lord
description: Anklet of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.|Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his clan before linking the flame. When he departed, he left only with his greatsword, his garb, and the crown, now bereft of power.

name: Antiquated Dress
description: A dress from the ancient fallen land of Oolacile. Its ivory-colored silk features elaborate embroidery and is imbued with ancient magic power.|One cannot expect any physical protection from this garment, as it was not meant to be worn in battle.

name: Antiquated Gloves
description: Gloves from the ancient fallen land of Oolacile. Their ivory-colored silk features elaborate embroidery and are imbued with ancient magic power.|One cannot expect any physical protection from these, as they were not meant to be worn in battle.

name: Antiquated Skirt
description: A skirt from the ancient fallen land of Oolacile. Its ivory-colored silk features elaborate embroidery and is imbued with ancient magic power.|One cannot expect any physical protection from this garment, as it was not meant to be worn in battle.

name: Armor of Artorias
description: Armor of Artorias the Abysswalker, one of Gwyn's four knights.|The death of the armor's owner can be surmised from the corrosive Dark of the Abyss, and the tattered azure-blue cape, once a symbol of pride and glory.

name: Armor of Thorns
description: Armor of Kirk, knight of Thorns and notorious member of the Darkwraiths. A dense patch of thorns grows from its surface.|It is a fitting item for the murderous Kirk, for by simply wearing it and rolling, one can damage enemies.

name: Armor of the Glorious
description: Strange armor from the ancient land of Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall.|The many medals are believed to symbolize glory.

name: Armor of the Sun
description: Armor of Solaire of Astora, Knight of Sunlight. The large holy symbol of the Sun, while powerless, was painted by Solaire himself.|Solaire's incredible prowess must have come from rigorous training alone, for his equipment exhibits no special traits.

name: Balder Armor
description: Armor worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. It is made from thick iron plates.|Balder was the homeland of the Knight King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a great many Undead were spawned.

name: Balder Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. It is made from thick iron plates.|Balder was the homeland of the Knight King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a great many Undead were spawned.

name: Balder Helm
description: Helm worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. It is made from thick iron plates.|Balder was the homeland of the Knight King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a great many Undead were spawned.

name: Balder Leggings
description: Leggings worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. It is made from thick iron plates.|Balder was the homeland of the Knight King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a great many Undead were spawned.

name: Big Hat
description: Gigantic hat worn by the great sorcerer Logan. It completely hid his face, which led to his nickname "Big Hat."|Famously antisocial, Logan used it to block out noise and people's stares so he could focus on his own thoughts, but it does not possess any special magic powers.

name: Black Cleric Robe
description: Robe worn by pardoners serving Velka, the Goddess of Sin.|The pardoners' attire is uniformly black in color and said to be imbued with Velka's mystical power, which provides resistance against all manner of magic.

name: Black Iron Armor
description: Armor of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight known for his great strength.|Built of a special black iron and providing strong defense, notably against fire, but so terrible heavy to be unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.

name: Black Iron Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight known for his great strength.|Built of a special black iron and providing strong defense, notably against fire, but so terrible heavy to be unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.

name: Black Iron Helm
description: Helm of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight known for his great strength.|Built of a special black iron and providing strong defense, notably against fire, but so terrible heavy to be unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.

name: Black Iron Leggings
description: Leggings of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight known for his great strength.|Built of a special black iron and providing strong defense, notably against fire, but so terrible heavy to be unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.

name: Black Knight Armor
description: Armor of the Black Knight who haunt Lordran.|The knights followed Lord Gwyn when he departed to link the flame, but they were burned to ashes in newly kindled fire, wandering the world as disembodied spirits ever after.

name: Black Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Black Knights who haunt Lordran.|The knights followed Lord Gwyn when he departed to link the flame, but they were burned to ashes in newly kindled fire, wandering the world as disembodied spirits ever after.

name: Black Knight Helm
description: Helm of the Black Knight who haunt Lordran.|The knights followed Lord Gwyn when he departed to link the flame, but they were burned to ashes in newly kindled fire, wandering the world as disembodied spirits ever after.

name: Black Knight Leggings
description: Leggings of the Black Knights who haunt Lordran.|The knights followed Lord Gwyn when he departed to link the flame, but they were burned to ashes in newly kindled fire, wandering the world as disembodied spirits ever after.

name: Black Leather Armor
description: This armor made of smooth black leather is extremely quiet, a good thing for those who hide in the shadows.|The leather itself is thick, offering a decent level of protection.

name: Black Leather Boots
description: These boots made of smooth black leather are extremely quiet, a good thing for those who hide in the shadows.|The leather itself is thick, offering a decent level of protection.

name: Black Leather Gloves
description: These gloves made of smooth black leather are extremely quiet, a good thing for those who hide in the shadows.|The leather itself is thick, offering a decent level of protection.

name: Black Manchette
description: Manchette worn by pardoners serving Velka, the Goddess of Sin.|The pardoners' attire is uniformly black in color and said to be imbued with Velka's mystical power, which provides resistance against all manner of magic.

name: Black Sorcerer Boots
description: Boots worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School.|They secretly work with sound-based spells, and never reveal themselves.

name: Black Sorcerer Cloak
description: Cloak worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School.|They secretly work with sound-based spells, and never reveal themselves.

name: Black Sorcerer Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School.|They secretly work with sound-based spells, and never reveal themselves.

name: Black Sorcerer Hat
description: Hat worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School.|They secretly work with sound-based spells, and never reveal themselves.

name: Black Tights
description: Tights worn by pardoners serving Velka, the Goddess of Sin.|The pardoners' attire is uniformly black in color and said to be imbued with Velka's mystical power, which provides resistance against all manner of magic.

name: Bloated Head
description: The head of an Oolacile resident whose humanity went wild after being devoured by the Dark of Manus, father of the Abyss.|The bloated head is fissured, the cracks lined with innumerable tiny red eyeballs with a hard outside and mucous-filled inside, no sane person could ever wear it.

name: Bloated Sorcerer Head
description: The head of an Oolacile resident whose humanity went wild after being devoured by the Dark of manus, father of the Abyss.|The bloated head is fissured, the cracks lined with innumerable tiny red eyeballs and accented by protuding brain parts. It is lightly enchanted, suggesting that it may have belonged to a sorcerer.

name: Blood-Stained Skirt
description: Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.|It is thought to have once been the white skirt of a maiden, but its true origin is lost in patches of blood. Perhaps its former wearer was maimed to prevent escape?

name: Boots of the Explorer
description: Strange boots from the ancient land of Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall.|The inlaid silver rings symbolize an explorer.

name: Bracelet of the Great Lord
description: Bracelet of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.|Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his clan before linking the flame. When he departed, he left only with his greatsword, his garb, and the crown, now bereft of power.

name: Brass Armor
description: Armor of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.|After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received this armor, which hides her hideous form and helps her hunt the guilty.

name: Brass Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.|After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received these gauntlets, which hide her hideous form and help her hunt the guilty.

name: Brass Helm
description: Helm of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.|After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received this helm, which hides her hideous form and helps her hunt the guilty.

name: Brass Leggings
description: Leggings of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.|After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received these leggings, which hides her hideous form and help her hunt the guilty.

name: Brigand Armor
description: Armor worn by the brigands who raid mountain hamlets and attack travelers.|The addition of metal over a base of cloth and leather offers good mobility and defense.

name: Brigand Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by the brigands who raid mountain hamlets and attack travelers.|The addition of metal over a base of cloth and leather offers good mobility and defense.

name: Brigand Hood
description: Hood worn by the brigands who raid mountain hamlets and attack travelers.|In addition to protecting against the blazing sun, dust, and sand, it helps them tell friend from foe in the heat of battle.

name: Brigand Trousers
description: Trousers worn by the brigands who raid mountain hamlets and attack travelers.|The addition of metal over a base of cloth and leather offers good mobility and defense.

name: Catarina Armor
description: Distinctively shaped armor worn by the Knights of Catarina.|Outside of Catarina, it is often ridiculed for their onion-like shape, infuriating the proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying.

name: Catarina Gauntlets
description: Distinctively shaped gauntlets worn by the Knights of Catarina.|Outside of Caterina, they are often ridiculed for their onion-like shape, infuriating the proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying.

name: Catarina Helm
description: Distinctively shaped helm worn by the Knights of Catarina.|Outside Catarina, they are often ridiculed for their onion-like shape, infuriating the proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying.

name: Catarina Leggings
description: Distinctively shaped leggings worn by the Knights of Catarina.|Outside of Caterina, they are often ridiculed for their onion-like shape, infuriating the proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying.

name: Chain Armor
description: Chainmail armor of thin interlinking rings of steel. It is common throughout the human world since it can be easily produced, is not too heavy, and offers good defense.|Knights may favor flashy armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, anything is fine as long as it keeps them alive.

name: Chain Helm
description: A chainmail helm of thin interlinking rings of steel. It is common throughout the human world since it can be easily produced, is not too heavy, and offers good defense.|Knights may favor flashy armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, anything is fine as long as it keeps them alive.

name: Chain Leggings
description: Chainmail leggings of thin interlinking rings of steel. It is common  throughout the human world since it can be easily produced, is not too heavy, and offers good defense.|Knights may favor flashy armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, anything is fine as long as it keeps them alive.

name: Chester's Gloves
description: Leather gloves worn by Marvellous Chester, a man of mystery lost in the past.|These gloves have no distinguishing features, but are of extremely high quality.

name: Chester's Long Coat
description: Black leather long coat hat worn by Marvellous Chester, a man of mystery lost in the past.|This exquisitely sewn aristocratic suit allows its wearer to move in silence, lending well to stealth.

name: Chester's Trousers
description: Black leather trousers worn by Marvellous Chester, a man of mystery lost in the past.|These exquisitely sewn trousers are decorated with silver trinkets of varying sizes, and have straps on the inner legs for carrying crossbow bolts.

name: Cleric Armor
description: Armor worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.|It is rather substantial in size and weight, making its wearer look even bigger than he actually is.

name: Cleric Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.|They are rather substantial in size and weight, making their wearer look even bigger than he actually is.

name: Cleric Helm
description: Helm worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.|It is rather substantial in size and weight, making its wearer look even bigger than he actually is.

name: Cleric Leggings
description: Leggings worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.|They are rather substantial in size and weight, making their wearer look even bigger than he actually is.

name: Crimson Gloves
description: Gloves of the sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal away the Darkwraiths, and the Four Kings who descended into Dark.|The Sealers were once known as healers, and the bright crimson was a symbol of that.

name: Crimson Robe
description: Robe of the sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal away the Darkwraiths and the Four Kings who descended into Dark.|The Sealers were once known as healers, and the bright crimson was a symbol of that.

name: Crimson Waistcloth
description: Waistcloth of the sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal away the Darkwraiths, and the Four Kings who descended into dark.|The Sealers were once known as healers, and the bright crimson was a symbol of that.

name: Crown of Dusk
description: Special magic crown bestowed upon Dusk, Princess of Oolacile, upon her birth.|Its wearer is blessed by all manner of magic. This raises the power and effect of the wearer's magic, but damage suffered by magic attack also rises.

name: Crown of the Dark Sun
description: Crown of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.|This crown of the gods demands faith immeasurable of its wearer, but it is imbued with Darkmoon power that enhances all magic. The image of the sun manifests Gwyndolin's deep adoration of the sun.

name: Crown of the Great Lord
description: Crown of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.|Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his great clan before linking the flame. But he did keep his crown, perhaps to preserve a symbol of the monarch, for its actual power had fully subsided.

name: Crystalline Armor
description: Armor worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.|The crystal provides powerful defense, but it cannot be used for long because it is easily broken and cannot be repaired.

name: Crystalline Gauntlets
description: Armor worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.|The crystal provides powerful defense, but it cannot be used for long because it is easily broken and cannot be repaired.

name: Crystalline Helm
description: Helm worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.|The crystal power provides powerful defense, but it cannot be used for long because it is easily broken and cannot be repaired.

name: Crystalline Leggings
description: Leggings worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.|The crystal power provides good defense, but they cannot be used for long because they are easily broken and cannot be repaired.

name: Dark Armor
description: Armor of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.|Their armor transformed, and remains a symbol of the Dark servants and their diabolical art of Lifedrain.

name: Dark Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.|Their gauntlets transformed, and remain symbol of the Dark servants and their diabolical art of Lifedrain.

name: Dark Leggings
description: Leggings of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.|Their leggings transformed, and remain a symbol of the Dark servants and their diabolical art of Lifedrain.

name: Dark Mask
description: Mask of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.|Some say the skeletal mask of an ancient Darkwraith is partially fused with the flesh of its face.

name: Dingy Gloves
description: Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.|They are thought to have once been the white gloves of a maiden, but smoke and ashes from bonfires darkened them over the years.

name: Dingy Hood
description: Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.|It is thought to have once been the white hood of a maiden, but smoke and ashes from bonfires darkened it over the years.

name: Dingy Robe
description: Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.|It is thought to have once been the white robe of a maiden, but smoke and ashes from bonfires darkened it over the years.

name: Eastern Armor
description: A distinctive armor made in an Eastern land.|Exquisitely crafted, this armor offers excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.

name: Eastern Gauntlets
description: Distinctive gauntlets made in an Eastern land.|Exquisitely crafted, these gauntlets offer excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.

name: Eastern Helm
description: A distinctive helm made in an Eastern land.|Exquisitely crafted, this helm offers excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.

name: Eastern Leggings
description: Distinctive leggings made in an Eastern land.|Exquisitely crafted, these leggings offer excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.

name: Elite Knight Armor
description: Armor of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora, based on the fire-warding heraldic symbol on its blue surcoat.|Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow.

name: Elite Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora.|Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow.

name: Elite Knight Helm
description: Helm of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora.|Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow.

name: Elite Knight Leggings
description: Leggings of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora.|Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow.

name: Embraced Armor of Favor
description: Armor of Lautrec the Embraced, representing the goddess Fina's love.|The goddess's arms wrap around it, as if to embrace the wearer.

name: Fang Boar Helm
description: Severed head of the fully-armored Fang Boar taken by the one who killed it as proof of his victory, just as the Gods once did with the head of the ancient dragon.|Can be worn on the head as a surprisingly sound piece of protective gear.

name: Gargoyle Helm
description: Helm of the gargoyle, an enchanted creature that guarded the Bell of Awakening in the belfry of the Undead Church.|This bronze helm was for mere appearance's sake, as gargoyle skin is naturally hard. Little in the way of defense can be expected from it.

name: Gauntlets of Artorias
description: Gauntlets Of Artorias the Abysswalker, one of Gwyn's four knights.|The death of the their owner can be surmised from the corrosive Dark of the Abyss, which has compromised their protective utility.

name: Gauntlets of Favor
description: Gauntlets of Lautrec the Embraced, representing the goddess Fina's love.|During his solitude, he forsook everything, for he believed in the goddess's love for him.

name: Gauntlets of Thorns
description: Gauntlets of Kirk, Knight of Thorns and notorious member of the Darkwraiths. A dense patch of thorns grows from their surface.|They are a fitting item for the murderous Kirk, for by simply wearing them and rolling, one can damage enemies.

name: Gauntlets of the Channelers
description: Gauntlets of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve Seath the Scaleless. Even after the onset of Seath's madness, the "snatchers" as they were often called, ventured to far lands to find suitable human specimens.|The heaviest of protective gear for sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

name: Gauntlets of the Vanquisher
description: Strange gauntlets from the ancient land of Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall.|The gold bracelets symbolize a vanquisher.

name: Giant Armor
description: Armor of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.|Made from ancient brass, it also offers protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to its giant size, it is extremely heavy for humans, and impedes stamina recovery.

name: Giant Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.|Made from ancient brass, they also offer protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to their giant size, they are extremely heavy for humans, and impede stamina recovery.

name: Giant Helm
description: Helm of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.|Made from ancient brass, it also offers protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to its giant size, it is extremely heavy for humans, and impedes stamina recovery.

name: Giant Leggings
description: Leggings of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.|Made from ancient brass, they also offer protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to their giant size, they are extremely heavy for humans, and impede stamina recovery.

name: Gold-Hemmed Black Cloak
description: Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.|She wore this gold-hemmed black cloak before even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

name: Gold-Hemmed Black Gloves
description: Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.|She wore these gold lined black gloves before even the Age of Fire, and they offer strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

name: Gold-Hemmed Black Hood
description: Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.|She wore this gold-hemmed black hood before even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

name: Gold-Hemmed Black Skirt
description: Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.|She wore this gold-hemmed black skirt before even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

name: Golem Armor
description: Body of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.|Without its core, it is a mere hunk of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but its immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

name: Golem Gauntlets
description: Arms of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.|Without its core, they are mere hunks of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but their immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

name: Golem Helm
description: Head of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.|Without its core, it is a mere hunk of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but its immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

name: Golem Leggings
description: Legs of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.|Without its core, they are mere hunks of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but their immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

name: Gough's Armor
description: Armor of Hawkeye Gough, one of Gwyn's Four Knights.|Armor donned by Gough since his days as a dragonslayer. The medallion, bequeathed by the Lord Himself, and the dragon bone pauldrons are symbols of the highest honors.

name: Gough's Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of Hawkeye Gough, one of Gwyn's Four Knights.|Received as a decoration of honor. Crafted of similar material to the gauntlets worn by the Silver Knights.

name: Gough's Helm
description: Helm of Hawkeye Gough, one of Gwyn's Four Knights. Received as a decoration of knightly honor.|A helm crafted especially for the honorable Hawkeye Gough, only the eye holes were packed with tree resin by those who dismissed Gough as a brutish giant.

name: Gough's Leggings
description: Leggings of Hawkeye Gough, one of Gwyn's Four Knights.|Received as a decoration of honor. Crafted of similar material to the gauntlets worn by the Silver Knights.

name: Guardian Armor
description: Armor of the stone knights, guardians of the forest sanctuary.|The stone knights are golems animated by magic, and their enchanted armor is oppressively heavy.

name: Guardian Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the stone knights, guardians of the forest sanctuary.|The stone knights are golems animated by magic, and their enchanted gauntlets are oppressively heavy.

name: Guardian Helm
description: Helm of the stone knights, guardians of the forest sanctuary.|The stone knights are golems animated by magic, and their enchanted helms are oppressively heavy.

name: Guardian Leggings
description: Leggings of the stone knights, guardians of the forest sanctuary.|The stone knights are golems animated by magic, and their enchanted leggings are oppressively heavy.

name: Hard Leather Armor
description: Armor made of thick leather. Very common type of protective gear, it provides a sound level of defense.

name: Hard Leather Boots
description: Boots made of thick leather. Very common type of protective gear, they provides a sound level of defense.

name: Hard Leather Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets made of thick leather. Very common type of protective gear, they provide a sound level of defense.

name: Havel's Armor
description: Armor worn by Havel the Rock's warriors. Carved from solid rock, its tremendous weight is matched only by the defense it provides.|Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

name: Havel's Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by Havel the Rock's warriors. Carved from solid rock, their tremendous weight is matched only by the defense it provides.|Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

name: Havel's Helm
description: Helm worn by Havel the Rock's warriors. Carved from solid rock, its tremendous weight is matched only by the defense it provides.|Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

name: Havel's Leggings
description: Leggings worn by Havel the Rock's warriors. Carved from solid rock, their tremendous weight is matched only by the defense it provides.|Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

name: Heavy Boots
description: Boots made of thick leather. The boots of the pyromancers are incredibly tough, on account of the rugged grasslands and treacherous swamps they must traverse. Their soles are nearly impenetrable.

name: Helm of Artorias
description: Helm of Artorias the Abysswalker, one of Gwyn's four knights.|The death of the helm's owner can be surmised from the corrosive Dark of the Abyss, and the musty azure-blue tassel, once a symbol of pride and glory.

name: Helm of Favor
description: Helm of Lautrec the Embraced, representing the goddess Fina's love.|During his solitude, he forsook everything, for he believed in the goddess's love for him.

name: Helm of Thorns
description: Helm of Kirk, knight of Thorns and notorious member of the Darkwraiths. A dense patch of thorns grows from its surface.|It is a fitting item for the murderous Kirk, for by simply wearing it and rolling, one can damage enemies.

name: Helm of the Wise
description: A strange helm from the ancient land of Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall.|The two horns are believed to symbolize wisdom.

name: Hollow Soldier Armor
description: Armor worn by Hollow soldiers. It may be old and battered, but its iron construction makes it quite sturdy.

name: Hollow Soldier Helm
description: Helm worn by Hollow soldiers. It may be old and battered, but its iron construction makes it quite sturdy.|It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head protection against arrows and other physical threats.

name: Hollow Soldier Waistcloth
description: Waistcloth worn by Hollow soldiers. It is so tattered that it barely serves its purpose anymore.

name: Hollow Thief's Hood
description: Hood worn by Hollow thieves. Used to hide a guilty countenance.

name: Hollow Thief's Leather Armor
description: Leather armor worn by Hollow thieves. It stifles noise and helps its wear hide in the shadows.

name: Hollow Thief's Tights
description: Tights worn by Hollow thieves. They stifle noise and help their wearer hide in the shadows.

name: Hollow Warrior Armor
description: Armor worn by Hollow warriors. It is made of thick leather that is tattered with age.

name: Hollow Warrior Helm
description: Helm worn by Hollow warriors. Although it is made of iron, it is old, battered and worn out.|It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head protection against arrows and other physical threats.

name: Hollow Warrior Waistcloth
description: Waistcloth worn by Hollow Warriors. It is so tattered that it barely serves its purpose anymore.

name: Holy Robe
description: Robe donned by the men of the cloth. Though plain to the eye, its hardy fabric repels rain and keeps the body warm.|Those dissatisfied with church teachings must test their faith by going on a spiritual journey. Such is the ritual of self-purification of the Way of the White.

name: Holy Trousers
description: Trousers donned by the men of the cloth, Though plain to the naked eye, their hardy fabric repels rain and keeps the body warm.|Those dissatisfied with church teachings must test their faith by going on a spiritual journey. Such is the ritual of self-purification of the Way of the White.

name: Iron Bracelet
description: Bracelets of Solaire of Astora, Knight of Sunlight. Of high quality, but lacking any particular powers.|Solaire's incredible prowess must have come from rigorous training alone, for his equipment exhibits no special traits.

name: Iron Helm
description: Helm of Solaire of Astora, Knight of Sunlight. Of high quality, but lacking any particular powers.|Solaire's incredible prowess must have come from rigorous training alone, for his equipment exhibits no special traits.

name: Iron Leggings
description: Leggings of Solaire of Astora, Knight of Sunlight. Of high quality, but lacking any particular powers.|Solaire's incredible prowess must have come from rigorous training alone, for his equipment exhibits no special traits.

name: Knight Armor
description: Armor of a lower-rank knight. Despite the thin metal used, the grooved texture gives it added protection.

name: Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of a lower-rank knight. Despite the thin metal used, the grooved texture gives them added protection.

name: Knight Helm
description: Helm of a lower-rank knight. Despite the thin metal used, the grooved texture gives it added protection.

name: Knight Leggings
description: Leggings of a lower-rank knight. Despite the thin metal used, the grooved texture gives them added protection.

name: Leather Armor
description: Armor made of soft leather. Very common type of protective gear.

name: Leather Boots
description: Boots made of soft leather. Very common type of protective gear.

name: Leather Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets made of soft leather. One of the more common kinds of protective gear.

name: Leather Gloves
description: Gloves made of soft leather. Very common type of protective gear.

name: Leggings of Artorias
description: Leggings of Artorias the Abysswalker, one of Gwyn's four knights.|The death of the their owner can be surmised from the corrosive Dark of the Abyss, which has compromised their protective utility.

name: Leggings of Favor
description: Leggings of Lautrec the Embraced, representing the goddess Fina's love.|During his solitude, he forsook everything, for he believed in the goddess's love for him.

name: Leggings of Thorns
description: Leggings of Kirk, knight of Thorns and notorious member of the Darkwraiths. A dense patch of thorns grows from their surface.|They are a fitting item for the murderous Kirk, for by simply wearing them and rolling, one can damage enemies.

name: Lord's Blade Gloves
description: Gloves worn by the Lord's Blade Ciaran, one of Gwyn's four knights.|Gloves common to all of the Lord's Blades. These deadly women shift nimbly between layers of darkness, etching streaks of gold into the night air, and planting visions of terror into the minds of their targets.

name: Lord's Blade Robe
description: Robe of the Lord's Blade Ciaran, one of Gwyn's Four Knights.|A robe common to all of the Lord's Blades, These deadly women shift nimbly between layers of darkness, etching streaks of gold into the night air, and planting visions of terror into the minds of their targets.

name: Lord's Blade Waistcloth
description: Waistcloth worn by the Lord's Blade Ciaran, one of Gwyn's four knights.|Waistcloth common to all of the Lord's Blades. These deadly women shift nimbly between layers of darkness, etching streaks of gold into the night air, and planting visions of terror into the minds of their targets.

name: Maiden Gloves
description: White gloves worn by traveling maidens. It is part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.|It is soft and well-made, but does not offer much in the way of defense, making it ill- suited to use in battle.

name: Maiden Hood
description: White hood worn by traveling maidens. It is part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.|It is soft and well-made, but does not offer much in the way of defense, making it ill- suited to use in battle.

name: Maiden Robe
description: White robe worn by traveling maidens. It is part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.|It is soft and well-made, but does not offer much in the way of defense, making it ill-suited to use in battle.

name: Maiden Skirt
description: White skirt worn by traveling maidens. It is part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.|It is soft and well-made, but does not offer much in the way of defense, making it ill- suited to use in battle.

name: Mask of Velka
description: Mask worn by pardoners serving Velka, the Goddess of Sin.|The pardoners listen to the confessions of sinners, urging reflection and salvation. Their masks symbolize separation from worldly desires.

name: Mask of the Child
description: One of the three masks of the Pinwheel, the necromancer who stole the power of the Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.|This mask, belonging to the naive child, slightly raises stamina recovery speed.

name: Mask of the Father
description: One of the three masks of the Pinwheel, the necromancer who stole the power of the Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.|This mask, belonging to the valiant father, slightly raises equipment load.

name: Mask of the Mother
description: One of the three masks of the Pinwheel, the necromancer who stole the power of the Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.|This mask, belonging to the kindly mother, slightly raises HP.

name: Mask of the Sealer
description: Mask of the sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal away the Darkwraiths, and the Four Kings who descended into Dark.|It symbolizes their resolve to keep the seal shut forever and their atonement for all who were sacrificed, but two of the three forsook New Londo upon tiring of their duty.

name: Moonlight Gloves
description: Gloves of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.|The power of the moon was strong in Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin, and hardly provides any physical defense.

name: Moonlight Robe
description: Robe of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.|The power of the moon was strong in Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin and hardly provides any physical defense.

name: Moonlight Waistcloth
description: Waistcloth of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.|The power of the moon was strong in Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin, and hardly provides any physical defense.

name: Ornstein's Armor
description: Armor of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo.|Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the Four Knights. His golden lion armor is imbued with the power of lightning and should provide good protection against it.

name: Ornstein's Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo.|Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the Four Knights. His golden lion gauntlets are imbued with the power of lightning and should provide good protection against it.

name: Ornstein's Helm
description: Helm of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo.|Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the Four Knights. His golden lion helm is imbued with the power of lightning and should provide good protection against it.

name: Ornstein's Leggings
description: Leggings of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo.|Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the Four Knights. His golden lion leggings are imbued with the power of lightning and should provide good protection against it.

name: Painting Guardian Gloves
description: Gloves worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo. Offer substantial protection versus magic.|They have guarded the Great Painting of Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down through generations, but the reason for doing so passed from all memory long ago.

name: Painting Guardian Hood
description: Hood worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo. Offer substantial protection versus magic.|They have guarded the Great Painting of Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down through generations, but the reason for doing so passed from all memory long ago.

name: Painting Guardian Robe
description: Robe worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo. Offer substantial protection versus magic.|They have guarded the Great Painting of Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down through generations, but the reason for doing so passed from all memory long ago.

name: Painting Guardian Waistcloth
description: Waisthcloth worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo. Offer substantial protection versus magic.|They have guarded the Great Painting of Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down through generations, but the reason for doing so passed from all memory long ago.

name: Paladin Armor
description: Armor of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs.|Long ago, the Way of the White produced its first Undead, a paladin in golden armor. With the legendary treasures Grant and Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran, Land of the Gods, in the first Undead mission of the Way of White.

name: Paladin Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs.|Long ago, the Way of the White produced its first Undead, a paladin in golden armor. With the legendary treasures Grant and Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran, Land of the Gods, in the first Undead mission of the Way of White.

name: Paladin Helm
description: Helm of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs.|Long ago, the Way of the White produced its first Undead, a paladin in golden armor. With the legendary treasures Grant and Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran, Land of the Gods, in the first Undead mission of the Way of White.

name: Paladin Leggings
description: Leggings of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs.|Long ago, the Way of the White produced its first Undead, a paladin in golden armor. With the legendary treasures Grant and Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran, Land of the Gods, in the first Undead mission of the Way of White.

name: Pharis's Hat
description: Broad-brimmed hat favored by the archer hero Pharis.|Pharis was an accomplished archer, and though he was human, he ranked alongside Hawkeye Gough, one of the Four Knights of Lord Gwyn. His hat is universally popular among children.

name: Porcelain Mask
description: Mask of the Lord's Blade Ciaran, one of Gwyn's Four Knights.|The cyclops headpiece is common to all of the Lord's Blades, but Ciaran was determined to earn this soft porcelain mask as a unique decoration of honor. The mask is lined with ivory locks of hair.

name: Priest's Hat
description: Distinctive hat worn only by Way of White priests in Thorolund.|It is simply meant to show their position within the hierarchy. It holds almost no meaning in the land of Lordran.

name: Robe of the Channelers
description: Robe of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve Seath the Scaleless. Even after the onset of Seath's madness, the "snatchers" as they were often called, ventured to far lands to find suitable human specimens.|The heaviest of protective gear for sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

name: Robe of the Great Lord
description: Robe of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.|Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his clan before linking the flame. When he departed, he left only with his greatsword, his garb, and the crown, now bereft of power.

name: Royal Helm
description: Helm of Vamos, skeleton blacksmith of the Catacombs. Partially made of gold, and confers high resistance overall.|The helm is believed to belong to an ancient royal line, but only Vamos would know for sure, and he shall never speak again.

name: Sack
description: Bloodstained patchwork sack by the Undead man-eating cook lurking in the Depths. Two eyeholes have been haphazardly cut out.|It is unexpectedly soft and comfortable to wear, but it is probably near meaningless in terms of defense.

name: Sage Robe
description: Robe worn by Big Hat Logan. It is said to have been from his apprentice days at Dragon School, but it is so worn out, no one knows what it originally looked like.|Logan, who cared little for his appearance, no doubt ever bothered to change out of it.

name: Shadow Garb
description: Black cloth garb worn by spooks from an Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder their unique form of martial arts.|While it sacrifices defense for the sake of greater mobility, it does offer resistance to bleeding and poison among other things, perhaps due to the nature of espionage.

name: Shadow Gauntlets
description: Black cloth gauntlets worn by spooks from an Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder their unique form of martial arts.|While they sacrifice defense for the sake of greater mobility, they do offer resistance to bleeding and poison among other things, perhaps due to the nature of espionage.

name: Shadow Leggings
description: Black cloth leggings worn by spooks from an Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder their unique form of martial arts.|While they sacrifice defense for the sake of greater mobility, they do offer resistance to bleeding and poison among other things, perhaps due to the nature of espionage.

name: Shadow Mask
description: Black cloth mask worn by spooks from an Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder their unique form of martial arts.|While it sacrifices defense for the sake of greater mobility, it does offer resistance to bleeding and poison among other things, perhaps due to the nature of their duty.

name: Silver Knight Armor
description: Armor of the Silver Knights who protect Anor Londo.|When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire, his knights split into two groups. The Silver Knights remained in the forsaken capital in the service of their goddess.

name: Silver Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Silver Knights who protect Anor Londo.|When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire, his knights split into two groups. The Silver Knights remained in the forsaken capital in the service of their goddess.

name: Silver Knight Helm
description: Helm of the Silver Knights who protect Anor Londo.|When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire, his knights split into two groups. The Silver Knights remained in the forsaken capital in the service of their goddess.

name: Silver Knight Leggings
description: Leggings of the Silver Knights who protect Anor Londo.|When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire, his knights split into two groups. The Silver Knights remained in the forsaken capital in the service of their goddess.

name: Six-Eyed Helm of the Channelers
description: Helm of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve Seath the Scaleless. The six eyes arranged in two vertical columns compensate for Seath's lack of sight.|The heaviest of protective gear for sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

name: Smough's Armor
description: Armor of Smough, the Executioner, protector of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor Londo. It offers extremely high defense and can be worn by humans, but not without great difficulty.

name: Smough's Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of Smough, the Executioner, protector of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor Londo. It offers extremely high defense and can be worn by humans, but not without great difficulty.

name: Smough's Helm
description: Helm of Smough, the Executioner, protector of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor Londo. It offers extremely high defense and can be worn by humans, but not without great difficulty.

name: Smough's Leggings
description: Leggings of Smough, the Executioner, protector of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor Londo. It offers extremely high defense and can be worn by humans, but not without great difficulty.

name: Snickering Top Hat
description: Black top hat worn by Marvellous Chester, a man of mystery lost in the past.|The wearer of this top hat cracks a dubious, permanent grin. The Curse of Chester!

name: Sorcerer Boots
description: Boots worn by proper sorcerers who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.|The majority take pride in having studied at the academy and look down on breaking the formal dress code established for sorcerers.

name: Sorcerer Cloak
description: Cloak worn by proper sorcerers who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.|The majority take pride in having studied at the academy and look down on breaking the formal dress code established for sorcerers.

name: Sorcerer Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by proper sorcerers who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.|The majority take pride in having studied at the academy and look down on breaking the formal dress code established for sorcerers.

name: Sorcerer Hat
description: Hat worn by proper sorcerers who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.|The majority take pride in having studied at the academy and look down on breaking the formal dress code established for sorcerers.

name: Standard Helm
description: A sturdy helm made of iron. Very common type of protective gear, it provides a sound level of defense.|It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head protection against arrows and other physical threats.

name: Steel Armor
description: Armor of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor.|Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

name: Steel Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor|Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

name: Steel Helm
description: Helm of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor.|Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

name: Steel Leggings
description: Leggings of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor.|Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

name: Stone Armor
description: Moss-covered armor of the Stone Knight, defender of the Darkroot Garden.|The Stone Knight is a product of ancient magic, and although this armor is also imbued with magic, it is incredibly heavy.

name: Stone Gauntlets
description: Moss-covered gauntlets of the Stone Knight, defender of the Darkroot Garden.|The Stone Knight is a product of ancient magic, and although these gauntlets are also imbued with magic, they are incredibly heavy.

name: Stone Helm
description: Moss-covered helm of the Stone Knight, defender of the Darkroot Garden.|The Stone Knight is a product of ancient magic, and although this helm is also imbued with magic, it is incredibly heavy.

name: Stone Leggings
description: Moss-covered leggings of the Stone Knight, defender of the Darkroot Garden.|The Stone Knight is a product of ancient magic, and although these leggings are also imbued with magic, they are incredibly heavy.

name: Sunlight Maggot
description: A loathsome parasite that inhabit Lost Izalith. It is completely immobile, yet still lives.|When worn on the head, it emanates blinding light, which is why it's known as a Sunlight Maggot.

name: Symbol of Avarice
description: Monster head resembling a treasure chest. Once an ancient god, it is said this is the symbol of shame imposed on a long lost clan, exiled for the sin of avarice.|Wearing this slightly raises soul absorption and item discovery, but also affects its wearer with the curse of the branded.

name: Tattered Cloth Hood
description: Hood worn by pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Though it appears tattered, it is actually quite strong.|Their attire offers substantial protection against poison, fire, and other forces of nature out in the hinterlands where they were driven.

name: Tattered Cloth Manchette
description: Manchette worn by pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Though it appears tattered, it is actually quite strong.|Their attire offers substantial protection against poison, fire, and other forces of nature out in the hinterlands where they were driven.

name: Tattered Cloth Robe
description: Robe worn by pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Though it appears tattered, it is actually quite strong.|Their attire offers substantial protection against poison, fire, and other forces of nature out in the hinterlands where they were driven.

name: Thief Mask
description: Mask of sinners. They hide their faces, stifle their voices and hide in the shadows. It does not provide much in the way of defense.

name: Traveling Boots
description: Boots worn by Big Hat Logan. They are indistinguishable from the ordinary kind worn by travelers.

name: Traveling Gloves
description: Gloves worn by Big Hat Logan. They are indistinguishable from the ordinary kind worn by travelers.

name: Traveling Gloves
description: Thick, sturdy gloves made for travelers on extended journeys.

name: Waistcloth of the Channelers
description: Waistcloth of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve Seath the Scaleless. Even after the onset of Seath's madness, the "snatchers" as they were often called, ventured to far lands to find suitable human specimens.|The heaviest of protective gear for sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

name: Wanderer Boots
description: Boots of an aimless traveler.|Made from sturdy leather. A must-have for long journeys.

name: Wanderer Coat
description: Coat of an aimless traveler. Made from sturdy leather and quilting.

name: Wanderer Hood
description: Hood of an aimless traveler. Made from sturdy leather, it offers protection versus wind and rain.

name: Wanderer Manchette
description: Manchette of an aimless traveler.|Made from sturdy leather and protects the hands.

name: Witch Cloak
description: Cloak of the rogue witch Beatrice.|Almost all magic users that employ catalysts studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is one of the few exceptions. She braved the Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

name: Witch Gloves
description: Gloves of the rogue witch Beatrice.|Almost all magic users that employ catalysts studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is one of the few exceptions. She braved the Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

name: Witch Hat
description: Hat of the rogue witch Beatrice.|Almost all magic users that employ catalysts studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is one of the few exceptions. She braved the Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

name: Witch Skirt
description: Skirt of the rogue witch Beatrice.|Almost all magic users that employ catalysts studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is one of the few exceptions. She braved the Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

name: Xanthous Crown
description: A mysterious item once worn by the Xanthous King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one knows where it came from.|The crown bears high-quality cloth which is quite soft to the touch, but its bright yellow color stings the eyes, and it is clearly far too big.

name: Xanthous Gloves
description: Mysterious items once worn by the Xanthous King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one knows where it came from.|They may be tattered, but its bright yellow color still stings the eyes.

name: Xanthous Overcoat
description: A mysterious item once worn by the Xanthous King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one knows where it came from.|It may be tattered, but its bright yellow color still stings the eyes.

name: Xanthous Waistcloth
description: A mysterious item once worn by the Xanthous King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one knows where it came from.|It may be tattered, but its bright yellow color still stings the eyes.
